title: Urinalysis – Physical Examination
body:
Physical Examination of Urine

Observe color, clarity, and specific gravity. Abnormal color may indicate hematuria, bilirubinuria, or infection. Turbidity may suggest crystals, cells, or bacteria.

title: Microscopic Examination of Urine Sediment
body:
Urine Sediment Analysis

Microscopic examination reveals cells, casts, crystals, and microorganisms. Key elements:

  • RBCs – hematuria
  • WBCs – infection or inflammation
  • Casts – renal pathology
  • Crystals – metabolic disorders

title: Stool Examination – Macroscopic and Microscopic
body:
Stool Analysis

Stool examination includes macroscopic observation (color, consistency, presence of blood/mucus) and microscopic analysis (ova, cysts, parasites). Common findings in parasitic infections include Giardia, Entamoeba, and helminth eggs.
